label: Healer (Physician/Herbalist)
description: Restores bodies and morale under scarcity. Aligns with compassion and healing motivations, but risks burnout and martyr complex; reputation swings between saint and quack depending on outcomes and politics.

label: Mercenary
description: Sells skill at arms to patrons. Clarifies wealth and survival motivations and tests honor under conflicting contracts; reputation is transactional and fragile.

label: Priest/Cleric
description: Mediates the sacred and the social. Balances faith and order with real‑world power; hypocrisy or fanaticism can explode institutions.

label: Thief
description: Specializes in acquisition without consent. Marries freedom and survival motivations to secrets and social reading; reputation is folk hero or parasite by audience.

label: Noble (Courtier/Patrician)
description: Wields status capital rather than labor. Legacy and reputation become plot engines; destiny arcs test stewardship vs. decadence.

label: Spy
description: Trades in information and misdirection. Truth and loyalty are constantly stress‑tested; unmasking is an ever‑present risk.

label: Soldier/Guard
description: Holds lines between order and chaos. Honor and protection center the arc; institutional rot creates moral injury and internal conflict.

label: Ranger/Scout
description: Operates between wilds and walls. Discovery and stewardship motivations mesh with adaptation; isolation is both asset and flaw.

label: Artisan/Craftsperson
description: Creates useful or beautiful goods. Anchors legacy and mastery motivations; conflict arrives via scarcity, guild politics, or theft.

label: Merchant/Factor
description: Brokers goods, routes, and influence. Wealth and progress meet ethics at scale; reputation hinges on fairness vs. exploitation.

label: Judge/Magistrate
description: Arbitrates competing claims. Justice motives face secrets and pressure; rigidity or bias imperils legitimacy.

label: Assassin
description: Kills to contract or cause. Justice and revenge blur; destiny squeezes conscience until something breaks—often the assassin.

label: Scholar/Lecturer
description: Generates and transmits knowledge. Curiosity and legacy drift toward hubris when unmoored; stakes rise when truth threatens power.

label: Engineer/Tinkerer
description: Solves material problems elegantly. Progress and mastery collide with resource and political limits; success redraws power maps.

label: Bard/Performer
description: Shapes morale and memory. Reputation is livelihood; truth vs. embellishment is an ongoing ethical duel.

label: Smuggler
description: Moves forbidden goods and people. Freedom and protection clash with law; reputation depends on whether the law serves justice.

label: Diplomat
description: Trades words for peace or leverage. Unity and balance define success; secrets and appeasement are occupational hazards.

label: Sailor/Navigator
description: Lives at the mercy of elements and charts. Discovery and survival motivations, chosen‑family dynamics, and shipboard law shape arcs.

label: Hunter/Tracker
description: Feeds communities or culls threats. Protection motives meet ethical lines about what is deemed prey and who decides.

label: Inquisitor/Inspector
description: Investigates heresy or crime with mandate. Truth and order risk cruelty without checks; reputation terrifies or reassures.

label: Alchemist
description: Experiments at the edge of taboo. Transcendence and progress motivations meet forbidden‑knowledge hunger; outcomes can be civilization‑shaking.

label: Courtesan/Companion
description: Navigates intimacy as craft and commerce. Security and agency motivations clash with stigma; information is a secondary currency.

label: Archivist/Chronicler
description: Keeps memory against decay or propaganda. Truth and legacy contend with censorship; reputation flips with regimes.

label: Warden/Jailer
description: Holds bodies and secrets. Order and security motivations, frequent moral injury; arcs ask what justice actually is.

label: Explorer/Cartographer
description: Expands known edges. Discovery and glory motivate; colonial ethics and risk shadow every map.

label: Farmer/Agrologist
description: Feeds civilizations. Stewardship and security motives; conflict rises from weather, pests, policy, and war’s requisitions.

label: Blacksmith/Armorer
description: Makes the tools of survival and war. Legacy and pride motives; ethical weight of arming tyrants vs. rebels.

label: Monk/Ascetic
description: Seeks clarity through discipline. Faith and transcendence motivate; rigidity or denial are ever‑present snares.

label: Detective/Investigator
description: Reconstructs truth from fragments. Truth and justice collide with secrets; obsession is a constant hazard.

label: Guildmaster
description: Orchestrates craftspeople and markets. Legacy and power motives; the character embodies the system they built and must choose reform or exploitation.

label: Tavern‑Keeper/Innkeeper
description: Community node and rumor hub. Belonging and wealth motives; neutrality is fragile once stakes rise.

label: Herald/Messenger
description: Carries news and treaties across borders. Unity and trust motives; reputation as reliable becomes the true passport.

label: Architect/City‑Planner
description: Shapes how people live together. Progress and legacy motives; politics and disasters test ethics at scale.

label: Beast‑Keeper/Falconer
description: Bonds with the non‑human. Protection and nature motives; empathy extends beyond people, complicating choices in war.

label: Relic‑Keeper/Curator
description: Guards potent artifacts or histories. Order and legacy motives; secrets about provenance are live wires.

label: Scout‑Courier (Runner/Rider)
description: Speed as service. Duty and glory motives; arcs hinge on endurance, trust, and the message that must get through.

label: Scribe/Calligrapher
description: Turns speech into record and art. Legacy and beauty motives; literacy is power, censorship the antagonist.

label: Shipwright
description: Builds the means of exploration and commerce. Progress and security motives; every launch is a bet against chaos.

label: Apothecary/Poisoner
description: Two faces of chemistry. Healing and power motives; ethics hinge on consent and context.

label: Forester/Game Warden
description: Mediates human‑wild boundaries. Stewardship motives; conflict is poachers, politics, and climate.

label: Teacher/Tutor
description: Shapes the next generation one mind at a time. Belief in others and legacy motives; impact measured in students, not applause.

label: Quartermaster
description: Allocates scarce resources fairly. Security and justice motives; corruption tempts, transparency protects.

label: Miner/Prospector
description: Digs wealth from darkness. Wealth and discovery motives; hazards externalize greed’s costs.

label: Banker/Usurer
description: Turns trust into capital. Security and power motives; reputation hinges on fairness versus predation.

label: Courier Guild Dispatcher
description: Moves people, packets, and secrets. Unity and logistics motives; a wrong route can start a war.

label: Arena Promoter
description: Profits from spectacle. Wealth and glory motives; ethics wobble under blood and cheers.

label: City Watch Captain
description: Frontline of civic order. Justice and order motives; politics squeeze from above while crime pushes from below.

label: Brewer/Winemaker
description: Ferments culture and community. Craft and belonging motives; temperance advocates and scarcity test resolve.

label: Street Orator/Agitator
description: Turns crowd into movement. Equality and revolution motives; reputation depends on what follows the speech.

label: Undertaker/Mortician
description: Steward of endings and memory. Dignity and service motives; secrets surface when the dead cannot speak.

label: Beloved
description: The character enjoys broad affection earned through visible service or charisma. Beloved status grants social capital but raises stakes when secrets or flaws threaten the image. Destiny often tests whether they protect the people who love them or the persona those people adore.

label: Revered
description: Venerated as more-than-mortal (saint, champion, founder), they inspire obedience—and brittle expectations. Reverence amplifies any fall from grace and attracts zealots and opportunists alike. Internal conflict centers on humility versus the weight of symbolhood.

label: Respected
description: A reputation for competence and fairness creates durable trust across factions. Respect smooths negotiations yet pressures the character to avoid risk that might tarnish reliability. Conflicts force a choice between safe adequacy and bold transformation.

label: Trusted
description: Known for keeping confidences and commitments, they become a keystone in networks. Trust grants access to secrets and high-stakes roles but turns any lapse into systemic collapse. Flaws like compulsive secrecy or people-pleasing either strengthen or shatter this status.

label: Honorable
description: Publicly aligned with a code, they are predictably principled—and predictable to adversaries. Honor legitimizes authority yet complicates compromises necessary for peace. Destiny hinges on whether the code serves people or pride.

label: Feared
description: Their name travels ahead as threat or inevitability. Fear compels compliance but breeds sabotage and isolation; love becomes suspect. Redemption arcs must convert terror into respect without losing deterrence.

label: Infamous
description: Notorious for a scandal or crime, they carry the magnetic stigma of transgression. Infamy grants leverage among outlaws and media but blocks institutional routes. Secrets about context or guilt can invert the label—or seal it.

label: Notorious
description: Famous for spectacle more than substance, they command attention but shallow loyalty. The reputation invites manipulation by flatterers and opportunists. Destiny tests whether they grow depth or double down on the show.

label: Underestimated
description: Dismissed as harmless or minor, they operate beneath notice. This grants tactical freedom but starves them of resources until a reveal. Breakout moments pivot the narrative and redraw power maps.

label: Overlooked
description: Invisible due to class, role, or bias, they witness what others miss. Overlooked status breeds both resentment and patience, making them potent truth-tellers. Recognition forces renegotiation with the world and with self-worth.

label: Pariah
description: Socially exiled for taboo or alleged betrayal, they live at civilization’s edges. Pariah status hardens self-reliance and forges unlikely coalitions among the discarded. Destiny asks if they return as reformer, avenger, or founder elsewhere.

label: Scapegoated
description: Official blame shields the powerful while staining the innocent. This reputation bends motivations toward truth-telling, justice, or survival. Exoneration arcs must show receipts, not rhetoric.

label: Misunderstood
description: Motives read wrong, methods misread, they bleed from friendly fire. Misunderstanding complicates alliances and encourages secrecy as self-defense. Clarifying acts risk vulnerability but unlock their true coalition.

label: Mysterious
description: A cultivated opacity—masks, aliases, ritual silence—turns them into a riddle. Mystery protects from prejudice and creates allure, but it chokes trust. The reveal must be worth the suspense.

label: Legendary
description: Stories about them inflate beyond fact, making the present compete with myth. Legendary status recruits followers and enemies shaped by tales rather than truth. The arc asks whether the person can edit their own legend.

label: Disgraced
description: A public failure or revealed hypocrisy toppled their standing. Disgrace forces reinvention or flight; institutions weaponize it to erase prior good. Redemption demands changed habits, not polished narratives.

label: Dishonored
description: Oath broken, banner stained, their name is a warning. The character confronts a choice: reclaim the code, rewrite it, or abandon it entirely. Every handshake tests whether trust can be rehabilitated.

label: Untested
description: Bright promise without proof, they are invested with hope and skepticism in equal measure. First trials define the narrative strongly, for good or ill. Mentors and saboteurs both rush to shape them.

label: Prodigy
description: Mastery arrived early, warping expectations and social age. Pressure to keep dazzling breeds perfectionism and isolation. The arc weighs excellence against humanity.

label: Charlatan
description: An expert at feigned expertise; their brand is borrowed certainty. Charisma yields quick wins while truth accrues compound interest against them. Unmasking is inevitable; the question is whether they pivot to honesty.

label: Reformed
description: Publicly turned from a past vice or crime, they carry both testimony and suspicion. Reformed status opens doors to heal or to grift; every stumble is judged as relapse. Accountability structures determine endurance.

label: Reluctant Icon
description: Elevated against their will by luck or symbol hunger, they resist the pedestal. The reputation grants reach while threatening authenticity. The arc explores stewardship without surrendering self.

label: Folk Hero
description: Claimed by the commons, not the court; songs carry their name farther than decrees. Folk acclaim protects and endangers, depending on who governs. Destiny asks whether they stay street-side or accept institutional power.

label: Outcast Visionary
description: Ideas run ahead of acceptance, and exile follows. They attract the curious and repel the comfortable. Time—or a catalyzing crisis—proves them prophet or crank.

label: Holy Figure
description: Aura of sanctity, real or projected, grants moral leverage. Temptations include control, hypocrisy, or gullibility toward flatterers. Testing comes when miracles fail or politics bite.

label: Heretic
description: Named dangerous for ideas or alliances, they split communities. Heresy can be truth before its time—or rot glamorized. The arc hinges on evidence and outcomes.

label: Patriot
description: Reputation tied to service of a nation or cause. Patriotism legitimizes sacrifice but blinds to sins done in the flag’s name. Conflict tests loyalty to people over symbols.

label: Traitor
description: Branded as betrayer—sometimes correctly, often conveniently. The mark endures beyond courts and wars; family inherits it. Reframing requires exposing the larger betrayal they resisted—or accepting the role fully.

label: Shadow Broker
description: Known for trading favors and secrets, not ideals. Their reputation buys access while taxing trust. The story asks whether they’ll spend that capital on something larger than themselves.

label: Lucky
description: Fortunate beyond the curve, they attract envy and risk. Luck covers sloppiness until it doesn’t; then reputation flips faster than skill can compensate. Maturity means building systems that don’t require miracles.
